intro: Disisorhipsalis macrantha, commonly known as the wax plant, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, making it well adapted to arid environments. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Disisorhipsalis macrantha prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
